ci_support_linux_64_r_base4.4.yaml:
c_compiler:
- gcc
c_compiler_version:
- '14'
c_stdlib:
- sysroot
c_stdlib_version:
- '2.17'
cdt_name:
- conda
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
cran_mirror:
- https://cran.r-project.org
cxx_compiler:
- gxx
cxx_compiler_version:
- '14'
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
pin_run_as_build:
  r-base:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
r_base:
- '4.4'
target_platform:
- linux-64
zip_keys:
- - c_compiler_version
  - cxx_compiler_version

about.summary: Contains some functions catching all messages, 'stdout' and other useful information while evaluating R code and other helpers to return user specified text elements (like: header, paragraph, table, image, lists etc.) in 'pandoc' markdown or several type of R objects similarly automatically transformed to markdown format. Also capable of exporting/converting (the resulting) complex 'pandoc' documents to e.g. HTML, 'PDF', 'docx' or 'odt'. This latter reporting feature is supported in brew syntax or with a custom reference class with a smarty caching 'backend'.

Also capable of exporting/converting (the resulting) complex 'pandoc' documents to e.g. HTML, 'PDF', 'docx' or 'odt'. This latter reporting feature is supported in brew syntax or with a custom reference class with a smarty caching 'backend'.

name: r-pander

about.summary: Contains some functions catching all messages, 'stdout' and other useful information while evaluating R code and other helpers to return user specified text elements (like: header, paragraph, table, image, lists etc.) in 'pandoc' markdown or several type of R objects similarly automatically transformed to markdown format. Also capable of exporting/converting (the resulting) complex 'pandoc' documents to e.g. HTML, 'PDF', 'docx' or 'odt'. This latter reporting feature is supported in brew syntax or with a custom reference class with a smarty caching 'backend'.

raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = "0.6.6" %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-pander
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/pander_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/pander/pander_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 8041e6b40c0212286f35020a11db180823fe1cb709f1d88ad657f28455692ade

build:
  skip: true  # [ppc64le]
  number: 1
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ compiler('c') }}          # [not win]
    - {{ stdlib("c") }}            # [not win]
    - {{ compiler('m2w64_c') }}    # [win]
    - {{ stdlib("m2w64_c") }}      # [win]
    - {{ compiler('cxx') }}        # [not win]
    - {{ compiler('m2w64_cxx') }}  # [win]
    - {{ posix }}filesystem        # [win]
    - {{ posix }}make
    - {{ posix }}sed               # [win]
    - {{ posix }}coreutils         # [win]
    - {{ posix }}zip               # [win]
    - cross-r-base {{ r_base }}    # [build_platform != target_platform]
  host:
    - r-base
    - r-rcpp
    - r-digest
    - pandoc
  run:
    - r-base
    - r-rcpp
    - r-digest
    - pandoc

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('pander')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('pander')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: http://rapporter.github.io/pander
  license: AGPL-3.0-only
  summary: "Contains some functions catching all messages, 'stdout' and other useful information while evaluating R code and other helpers to return user specified text elements (like: header, paragraph, table, image, lists etc.) in 'pandoc' markdown or several type of R objects similarly automatically transformed to markdown
    format. Also capable of exporting/converting (the resulting) complex 'pandoc' documents to e.g. HTML, 'PDF', 'docx' or 'odt'. This latter reporting feature is supported in brew syntax or with a custom reference class with a smarty caching 'backend'."
  license_family: AGPL
  license_file:
    - {{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/AGPL-3
    - LICENSE

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r

about.summary: Contains some functions catching all messages, 'stdout' and other useful information while evaluating R code and other helpers to return user specified text elements (like: header, paragraph, table, image, lists etc.) in 'pandoc' markdown or several type of R objects similarly automatically transformed to markdown format. Also capable of exporting/converting (the resulting) complex 'pandoc' documents to e.g. HTML, 'PDF', 'docx' or 'odt'. This latter reporting feature is supported in brew syntax or with a custom reference class with a smarty caching 'backend'.
